interview.q: When a pane is deleted and adjacent panes expand, should the user control which direction the adjacent pane expands, or should it be automatic based on position?
interview.a: Automatic based on position but we should be able to drag panes and have it intelligently adjust the layout accordingly

interview.q: For resizing panes, what should happen when a user drags the divider between two panes?
interview.a: Proportional resize within row/column

interview.q: Should pane sizes be persisted across browser sessions?
interview.a: Yes, persist to backend

interview.q: For the default ad-hoc terminal (when all panes are deleted), should it have special behavior or just be a normal pane?
interview.a: Normal pane, auto-created

interview.q: What minimum pane size feels right for your ultrawide?
interview.a: Current window: 1140x1270. 400x300px minimum is appropriate for future 3x3 grids.

interview.q: When adding a new pane to a partially-filled grid, where should it be placed?
interview.a: First empty slot, top-left priority

interview.q: How should the grid layout adapt when panes are added/removed?
interview.a: Dynamic: 1 pane = full, 2 panes = vertical split (side by side), 3 panes = 2+1 split (horizontal or vertical based on drag arrangement), 4 panes = 2x2

interview.q: For the 3-pane layout, how should the user indicate horizontal vs vertical arrangement?
interview.a: Drop zone indicators - show visual zones when dragging

interview.q: Should we use an existing layout library for the split-pane functionality?
interview.a: react-resizable-panels

interview.q: When removing single view mode, what should happen to users who have it selected?
interview.a: Existing terminal panes/sessions can be purged - not currently in use

interview.q: For backend persistence, what layout data should be stored per pane?
interview.a: Size percentages + position (width_percent, height_percent, row, col)

interview.q: What visual feedback should appear when dragging to rearrange panes?
interview.a: Highlighted drop zones + preview of resulting layout

interview.q: Should keyboard shortcuts be added for pane management?
interview.a: No shortcuts for now

interview.q: When a pane is resized, should the terminal inside immediately resize (reflow text) or wait until drag ends?
interview.a: Resize on drag end

interview.q: For future grid expansion (3x3, 4x4, etc.), should we build the data model to support arbitrary grids now?
interview.a: Build flexible model now - use percentage-based sizing that naturally scales

interview.q: How should users add a new pane when the grid isn't full?
interview.a: IMPORTANT: No main terminal window top bar. All controls in individual pane header bars only. Minimalistic design, maximize usable terminal space.

interview.q: For the pane header bar, which controls should be included?
interview.a: Every single control needed - if only pane header exists and a control is left off, we're stranded. Complete list required.

interview.q: Complete pane header controls audit
interview.a: Must include: Drag handle, Mode toggle (project panes), Pane name/swap dropdown, Add terminal (+), Clean prompt (claude mode), Upload file, Settings, Reset terminal, Close terminal, Overflow menu with global actions (Reset All, Close All)

interview.q: With all controls in pane headers, what should be the header height?
interview.a: Keep current 32px (8 tailwind units)

interview.q: For the resizable dividers between panes, what visual style should they have?
interview.a: Subtle line, visible handle on hover (1px border normally, 4px visible handle with accent color on hover)

interview.q: Should we phase this implementation or deliver all at once?
interview.a: All at once - single coherent release

interview.q: How should the system handle browser window resize when panes have custom sizes?
interview.a: Maintain proportions - pane sizes as percentages, all panes scale proportionally

interview.q: For backend persistence, should pane layout be stored at the global level or per-project?
interview.a: Global only

interview.q: When dragging panes to rearrange, should we keep dnd-kit or switch to react-resizable-panels?
interview.a: react-resizable-panels handles both resize AND reorder

interview.q: What testing approach should be used?
interview.a: Visual verification and testing of UI/UX using browser-automation. Full click, screenshot, review verification. Do not ask user to check until fully self-verified.

interview.q: When a pane is deleted in a 3-pane layout (2+1 split), what should happen?
interview.a: Smart collapse. If deleting solo pane: remaining 2 become VERTICAL split (side by side) for maximum terminal vertical real estate.

interview.q: For the default 2-pane layout, should they be arranged vertically or horizontally?
interview.a: Vertical split (side by side) - maximizes vertical space per terminal
